intro: Litsea moupinensis var. moupinensis, commonly known as the Moupin litsea, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at elevations ranging from 1,000 to 2,500 meters. Its leaves are usually elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinct aromatic scent when crushed. The fruit is a small, dark-colored drupe that develops from the flowers.
